DOCNAME: CASE OF MEHMET EREN v. TURKEY
CONCLUSION: Violation of Art. 3 (substantive aspect);Violation of Art. 3 (procedural aspect);Pecuniary damage - claim dismissed;Non-pecuniary damage - award
JUDGES: András Sajó;Françoise Tulkens;Ireneu Cabral Barreto;Nona Tsotsoria;Vladimiro Zagrebelsky
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE .

CARDINAL . On DATE at TIME the applicant , a journalist working for a DATE newspaper , was taken into custody by police officers from ORG of ORG along with CARDINAL other persons . At the time of the arrest , the applicant and the other arrestees were in the ORG branch of ORG ( HADEP ) , where demonstrations and hunger strikes were allegedly being organised , in order to protest about the arrest of PERSON , the leader of the ORG ( ORG , an illegal organisation .
CARDINAL . At TIME on DATE the applicant was taken to ORG . The doctor who examined him noted that there was no sign of recent physical violence on the applicant ’s person .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant made statements to the police . According to the report signed by CARDINAL police officers and the applicant , the applicant stated that he had been in the ORG branch of ORG in order to participate in the demonstration .

CARDINAL . The applicant alleges that he was subjected to various forms of illtreatment while in police custody . In particular , he was kept in a dark cell with insufficient ventilation , deprived of food and water and was prevented from going to the toilet . He was forced to stand , handcuffed , in the same position for TIME . During the questioning , he was stripped naked , insulted and threatened with death and rape . The applicant was beaten on various parts of his body . In particular , he received repeated blows to his abdomen . His testicles were squeezed and he was subjected to sexual abuse . Finally , he was forced to watch a female detainee being sexually abused .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant , along with CARDINAL other persons , was taken to a clinic in GPE and examined there by a medical expert , who drafted CARDINAL document in respect of all CARDINAL people , and noted that none of them had sustained any injuries .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant , along with CARDINAL other persons , was taken to the same clinic and examined there by another doctor , PERSON On a document of the police headquarters in which the names of all CARDINAL persons were put , PERSON noted the same sentence below every name :
“ No sign of physical violence has been observed ” .

The applicant claimed that there had been police officers present in the examination room and that although he had described the type of ill - treatment to which he had been subjected in police custody , the doctor did not note any of his complaints .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was brought before the public prosecutor at ORG . He maintained that he had been in the HADEP building as a journalist and that he had not participated in the demonstration or the hunger strike . He stated that he had been made to sign his police statements without reading them .
CARDINAL . At TIME on DATE , the applicant was released upon the decision of the public prosecutor .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was examined by a doctor from the ORG branch of ORG of GPE , PERSON , who recorded the following :

“ There is a bruise measuring QUANTITY on the right side of the hypogastrium . He has sensitivity and pain upon palpation behind his knees , pain in the ankles , sensitivity and pain in the toe muscles in both feet . He also has sensitivity in his testicles and epididymis , swelling in the groin ( may be the beginning of a hernia ) , sensitivity and pain in the epigastrium . An eruption on the occipital region has been observed . ”

CARDINAL . On an unspecified date the ORG branch of ORG of GPE referred the applicant to the GPE branch of ORG . CARDINAL DATE the applicant underwent various medical examinations , the results of which were noted in a medical report of CARDINAL DATE . According to this report , the applicant was suffering from a hernia in the groin , pain in various parts of his body and from major depression and an acute stress disorder , CARDINAL psychiatric conditions that normally are caused by traumatic experiences such as rape and torture . The doctors concluded that the applicant ’s complaints were consistent with his allegations of ill - treatment . While reaching this conclusion , the doctors from the GPE branch of ORG also noted the findings of the report of CARDINAL DATE drawn up by PERSON
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant underwent surgery for the hernia in his groin , which had allegedly occurred as a result of the ill - treatment he had suffered in police custody .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant drafted a document for his lawyers in which he described in detail the alleged ill - treatment that he had suffered during his police custody DATE . At the end of the document , he noted that the applicant ’s representative before the ORG and another advocate would bring proceedings on his behalf as his legal representatives .

CARDINAL . On CARDINAL DATE the applicant ’s lawyer lodged a complaint with the ORG public prosecutor ’s office that the applicant had been subjected to ill - treatment during his police custody . He submitted a copy of the medical report of CARDINAL DATE along with his petition .
CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG public prosecutor invited the applicant ’s representative to his office in order to make statements .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant ’s representative made statements to the public prosecutor . He contended that the applicant had requested him to initiate proceedings on his behalf DATE before DATE , the date on which he had lodged a complaint on behalf of the applicant . The representative further noted that the applicant ’s allegations were consistent with the findings of the report of CARDINAL DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG public prosecutor invited the applicant to his office in order to make statements .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant made statements to the public prosecutor . He noted that he had requested his lawyer to lodge a complaint against the persons who had inflicted ill - treatment on him . He contended that his lawyer had told him that he had initiated proceedings . The applicant stated that he had not applied to the public prosecutor ’s office himself . He finally requested that the police officers who had ill - treated him be punished .

CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG public prosecutor issued a decision not to prosecute in respect of the applicant ’s allegations of ill - treatment . In his decision , the public prosecutor noted that the applicant had been detained in police custody DATE and that the relevant medical reports did not reveal any sign of violence on the applicant ’s person . The public prosecutor further noted that the applicant had applied to ORG at the end of his custody period and that he should have lodged a complaint with the public prosecutor ’s office instead .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant ’s lawyer lodged an objection with ORG against the ORG public prosecutor ’s decision of DATE . He requested that persons who had been in police custody at the same time as the applicant be summoned to make statements . He further requested that the doctors who had drawn up the report of CARDINAL August DATE and PERSON , the doctor who had examined the applicant along with CARDINAL other persons on DATE , be heard . The lawyer also requested that the police officers who had been on duty during the applicant ’s detention in custody be determined and the photos of the applicant taken during his detention be included in the file , if there were any .

CARDINAL . On DATE a single judge at ORG dismissed the applicant ’s objection . In his decision , the judge noted that the applicant had been in police custody DATE and that the medical report of DATE , the date on which he was released , did not reveal any sign of violence on the applicant ’s person . He further observed that the applicant had not alleged illtreatment before the public prosecutor at ORG on DATE , immediately after his detention in police custody . The judge finally noted that the applicant had applied to ORG , and had lodged his complaint on DATE . The judge considered that the applicant ’s allegations were dubious , since he had lodged his application a long time after his release from police custody .

CARDINAL . A full description of the domestic law and practice at the relevant time may be found in GPE and Others v. GPE ( nos . PERSON and CARDINAL , § § CARDINAL - CARDINAL , ECHR CARDINAL-IV ( extracts ) ) .
